alert.note: Alert for Caguas; Gurabo; San Lorenzo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 06 at 8:49PM AST until February 06 at 11:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Caguas in Puerto Rico... Gurabo in Puerto Rico... San Lorenzo in Puerto Rico... * Until 1100 PM AST. * At 849 PM AST, The Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms, producing heavy rain, are moving into the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch is possible in the warned area. Flash flooding could begin shortly with this activity as the area rivers are already elevated. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Doppler Radar and USGS River Sensors. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of rivers, creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Mudslides. * For RIO GRANDE DE LOIZA at Rio Grande de Loiza at Caguas: At 8:30pm the stage was 12.04 feet. Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
